intro: Triodoglossum, commonly known as the broad-leafed buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals and a central cluster of stamens. The leaves are typically palmately divided, with a distinctive lobed appearance. These plants are often found in moist, grassy areas and are known for their ability to thrive in temperate climates. They play a role in pollination and are sometimes considered weeds in agricultural settings.
